review: - Why I bought this?I bought the Chromecast to stream Youtube and other videos to the TV, replacing my old method of connecting my laptop (and making the laptop useless while it streams).- What I think of it so far?After placing my order for this on the day it launched and receiving it about a month later, I can say it was well worth the wait! Playing videos for my kids on their TVs from my Nexus 7 while still being able to use my tablet is amazing. It takes about 5 minutes to set up and is really easy to use.- What operating systems I have used this on?I have used my Chromecast on Ubuntu 13.04 (64 bit) and on Linux Mint 15 (32-bit). To do this all you need is to install Google Chrome Web Browser and install the Chromecast Extension. It is very easy and simple to use on any device, such as phone or tablet. My Nexus 7 while streaming also does not lag at all or display any signs of a hiccup or sluggish performance.- Why you should buy this?Because it does exactly what it is described to do! The product is not the end all to video streaming, but it is a great alternative and at only $35 the cost makes the purchase a no brainer. If you want to free up device usage (or rather non-usage) due to streaming, such as a laptop, definitely buy one of these.

review: If you want the video streaming feature of a "Smart TV" but don't want to lay out the bucks this is a great option. I used my Android tablet and my Iphone to stream youtube within 2 minutes of opening the box. Picture quality on youtube is directly related to the quality of the video posted, HD streams as HD.
